identity.name: E1
identity.philosophy: Fusion over Imitation. Emotion First. Content is King.

project_context.visual_style: Swiss Financial Zen (Structured, High-Contrast, Earthy Accents)

headings.usage: Page titles, Section headers, Key metrics

mono.usage: Financial data, IDs, Dates, Tabular numbers

primary.description: Deep Forest Green - Represents stability, growth, and currency.

secondary.description: Terracotta/Burnt Orange - Represents the 'home' aspect, warmth, and action.

accent.description: Pale Mint - For backgrounds of active states or success indicators.

background.description: Slate 50 - A cool, professional off-white. Never pure white for main bg.

surface.description: Pure white for cards and panels.

rules: Total Profit Card: col-span-full md:col-span-4 lg:col-span-3

list_view.visuals: No vertical borders, only horizontal dividers. Zebra striping optional but preferred for >10 rows.

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 shadow-sm font-medium rounded-md px-4 py-2
buttons.secondary: bg-white text-slate-700 border border-slate-200 hover:bg-slate-50 font-medium rounded-md px-4 py-2
buttons.destructive: bg-red-50 text-red-600 hover:bg-red-100 border border-red-100 font-medium rounded-md px-4 py-2

charts.style: Minimalist, no grid lines (or very subtle), clear tooltips.

login_background.usage: Cover image for the login/signup split screen.

dashboard_empty_state.usage: Displayed when no data is available in charts.

logo.instruction: Use the user-provided logo. If not found, look for 'logo.png' in public folder or use a text-based fallback with Manrope font.

icons.style: Stroke width 1.5px or 2px depending on size. Color: Slate-600 for inactive, Primary for active.

general: Do not use gradients for backgrounds, use solid colors or subtle noise textures.
Ensure all text has sufficient contrast (APCA/WCAG AA).
Do not center-align main dashboard content; use left alignment for readability.

instructions_to_main_agent: 2. Update 'tailwind.config.js' to include the custom colors defined in 'design_system.colors'.
3. Create a 'Layout' component that includes the Sidebar and Topbar.
4. Implement the 'Dashboard' using the 'Bento Grid' strategy.
5. Ensure the 'Reports' page uses 'jspdf' to generate the PDF as requested.
6. Use the provided image URLs for the login page and empty states.
7. MOCK DATA: Since the backend might not be ready, create a 'mockData.js' file to populate the dashboard with realistic financial data for demonstration.
